blocks.name: negsym1
blocks.content: In the paper "On Variable Functors of Propositional Arguments", Lukasiewicz introduced a system that can handle variable connectives. This was done by introducing a variable, marked with a lowercase delta, which takes a wff as input. In the system, "delta ` ph ` " means that "something is true of ` ph ` ". The expression "delta ` ph ` " can be substituted with ` -. ph ` , ` ps /\ ph ` , ` A. x ph ` , etc. Later on, Meredith discovered a single axiom, in the form of ` ( ` delta delta ` F. -> ` delta ` ph ` ` ) ` . This represents the shortest theorem in the extended propositional calculus that cannot be derived as an instance of a theorem in propositional calculus. A symmetry with ` -. ` . (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 4-Sep-2011.)

blocks.name: imsym1
blocks.content: A symmetry with ` -> ` . See ~ negsym1 for more information. (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 4-Sep-2011.)

blocks.name: bisym1

blocks.name: nandsym1
blocks.content: A symmetry with ` -/\ ` . See ~ negsym1 for more information. (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 4-Sep-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm nandsym1(wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wnan(w0, wnan(w0, wfal)), wnan(w0, w1))
} = {
  sylibr(wnan(w0, wnan(w0, wfal)), wnan(w0, w1), wn(wa(w0, w1)))
  nsyl(wnan(w0, wnan(w0, wfal)), wa(w0, w1), wa(w0, wn(wa(w0, wfal))))
  sylnib(wnan(w0, wnan(w0, wfal)), wa(w0, wn(wa(w0, wfal))), wa(w0, wnan(w0, wfal)))
  biimpi(wnan(w0, wnan(w0, wfal)), wn(wa(w0, wnan(w0, wfal))))
  df-nan(w0, wnan(w0, wfal))
  anbi2i(w0, wnan(w0, wfal), wn(wa(w0, wfal)))
  df-nan(w0, wfal)
  jctir(wa(w0, w1), w0, wn(wa(w0, wfal)))
  simpl(w0, w1)
  intnan(w0, wfal)
  fal()
  df-nan(w0, w1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm nandsym1(wff w0, wff w1) {
  ⊢ ((w0 ⊼(w0 ⊼ F))→(w0 ⊼ w1))
} = {
  sylibr((w0 ⊼(w0 ⊼ F)), (w0 ⊼ w1), ¬(w0 ∧ w1))
  nsyl((w0 ⊼(w0 ⊼ F)), (w0 ∧ w1), (w0 ∧ ¬(w0 ∧ F)))
  sylnib((w0 ⊼(w0 ⊼ F)), (w0 ∧ ¬(w0 ∧ F)), (w0 ∧(w0 ⊼ F)))
  biimpi((w0 ⊼(w0 ⊼ F)), ¬(w0 ∧(w0 ⊼ F)))
  df-nan(w0, (w0 ⊼ F))
  anbi2i(w0, (w0 ⊼ F), ¬(w0 ∧ F))
  df-nan(w0, wfal)
  jctir((w0 ∧ w1), w0, ¬(w0 ∧ F))
  simpl(w0, w1)
  intnan(w0, wfal)
  fal()
  df-nan(w0, w1)
}

blocks.name: unisym1

blocks.name: amosym1
blocks.content: A symmetry with ` E* ` . See ~ negsym1 for more information. (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 13-Sep-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm amosym1(setvar s0, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wmo(s0, wmo(s0, wfal)), wmo(s0, w0))
} = {
  sylbi(wmo(s0, wmo(s0, wfal)), wmo(s0, w0), wi(wex(s0, wmo(s0, wfal)), weu(s0, wmo(s0, wfal))))
  moeu(s0, wmo(s0, wfal))
  ja(wex(s0, wmo(s0, wfal)), weu(s0, wmo(s0, wfal)), wmo(s0, w0))
  pm2.21i(wn(wex(s0, wmo(s0, wfal))), wmo(s0, w0))
  ax-mp(wn(wn(wex(s0, wmo(s0, wfal)))), wmo(s0, wfal))
  notnotd(wmo(s0, wfal), wex(s0, wmo(s0, wfal)))
  19.8a(s0, wmo(s0, wfal))
  pm2.21i(weu(s0, wmo(s0, wfal)), wmo(s0, w0))
  mto(weu(s0, wmo(s0, wfal)), wex(s0, wn(wmo(s0, wfal))))
  nex(s0, wn(wmo(s0, wfal)))
  notnoti(wmo(s0, wfal))
  mofal(s0)
  eunex(s0, wmo(s0, wfal))
}

blocks.name: subsym1
blocks.content: A symmetry with ` [ x / y ] ` . See ~ negsym1 for more information. (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 11-Sep-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm subsym1(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wsb(s0, s1, wsb(s0, s1, wfal)), wsb(s0, s1, w0))
} = {
  pm2.21i(wsb(s0, s1, wsb(s0, s1, wfal)), wsb(s0, s1, w0))
  mtbir(wsb(s0, s1, wsb(s0, s1, wfal)), wa(wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wsb(s0, s1, wfal)), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wsb(s0, s1, wfal)))))
  intnan(wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wsb(s0, s1, wfal)), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wsb(s0, s1, wfal))))
  nex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wsb(s0, s1, wfal)))
  intnan(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wsb(s0, s1, wfal))
  mtbir(wsb(s0, s1, wfal), wa(wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wfal), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wfal))))
  intnan(wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wfal), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wfal)))
  nex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wfal))
  intnan(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wfal)
  fal()
  dfsb1(s0, s1, wfal)
  dfsb1(s0, s1, wsb(s0, s1, wfal))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm subsym1(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ([s0 / s1][s0 / s1]F →[s0 / s1]w0)
} = {
  pm2.21i([s0 / s1][s0 / s1]F, [s0 / s1]w0)
  mtbir([s0 / s1][s0 / s1]F, ((s1 = s0 →[s0 / s1]F)∧ ∃(s1,(s1 = s0 ∧[s0 / s1]F))))
  intnan((s1 = s0 →[s0 / s1]F), ∃(s1,(s1 = s0 ∧[s0 / s1]F)))
  nex(s1, (s1 = s0 ∧[s0 / s1]F))
  intnan(s1 = s0, [s0 / s1]F)
  mtbir([s0 / s1]F, ((s1 = s0 → F)∧ ∃(s1,(s1 = s0 ∧ F))))
  intnan((s1 = s0 → F), ∃(s1,(s1 = s0 ∧ F)))
  nex(s1, (s1 = s0 ∧ F))
  intnan(s1 = s0, wfal)
  fal()
  dfsb1(s0, s1, wfal)
  dfsb1(s0, s1, [s0 / s1]F)
}
